channel.title: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question
channel.description:
OK, well I was trying to get rid of some space on my hard drive because it is getting that low and I was looking through the JDK folder and it seems to have the same stuff in my JRE folder. Is there some way I can set up JDK as my default JRE so as to free up space and remove the installed JRE version?
If that makes any sense, I don't know really :confused:

item.title: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

Well it does have a java.exe and javaw.exe in the bin directory, do those work?

Read full topic
item.source: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question

item.title: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

JDK is for developing in Java. If you compile java files, you need JDK. If you don’t want it, just uninstall it.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question

item.title: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Just keep both… You can delete older versions if you want.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question

item.title: I have a quick JDK vs JRE question
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

JDK does not have the same stuff as your JRE.
